<para>CXL is a high-speed interconnect technology based on the PCIe physical layer. It is designed to provide low-latency, high-bandwidth communication between different types of devices, such as memory, CPUs, FPGAs, GPUs and other domain-specific accelerators. The CXL standard consists of three protocols: 1) CXL.io, which connects multiple CXL devices together for high-speed device-to-device communication; 2) CXL.cache, which maintains cache coherency between devices and memory; and 3) CXL.memory that maintains coherency among shared memory.
To this moment, CXL has been designed to support three main device types:
Type 1. Type 1 CXL devices implement only CXL.io and CXL.cache interfaces. They include accelerators and SmartNICs that do not have local memory. They access the host memory and preserve coherency of a local cache with the host memory through CXL.cache.
Type 2. Type 2 CXL devices support all three protocols. These are computes, such as GPUs and FPGAs, that have local memory accessible to other hosts. They can exchange the data with other hosts via CXL.mem.
Type 3. Type 3 CXL devices implement only CXL.io and CXL.mem interfaces. These devices are used to increase memory capacity and bandwidth.</para>

Could you provide a list of suggestions to change the wording?
chatgpt_after:
Yes, I can definitely provide some suggestions for improving the wording of your summary! Here they are:
1. In the first sentence, consider rephrasing "based on" to "using" or "leveraging."

3. In the third sentence, consider adding a "which" before "maintains cache coherency." 
4. In the fourth sentence, consider rephrasing "To this moment" to "Currently." 
5. In the fifth sentence, use "implement" instead of "support." 
6. In the sixth sentence, use "compute devices" instead of "computes." 
7. In the seventh sentence, consider rephrasing "accessible to other hosts" to "accessible by other devices." 
8. In the eighth sentence, consider using "device" instead of "host" for consistency. 
9. Finally, consider providing a brief explanation of what CXL stands for (Compute Express Link) to provide context for readers who may not be familiar with the technology.

CXL is a high-speed interconnect technology based on the PCIe physical layer. It is designed to provide low-latency, high-bandwidth communication between different types of devices, such as memory, CPUs, FPGAs, GPUs and other domain-specific accelerators. The CXL standard consists of three protocols: 1) CXL.io, which connects multiple CXL devices together for high-speed device-to-device communication; 2) CXL.cache, which maintains cache coherency between devices and memory; and 3) CXL.memory that maintains coherency among shared memory.
To this moment, CXL has been designed to support three main device types:
Type 1. Type 1 CXL devices implement only CXL.io and CXL.cache interfaces. They include accelerators and SmartNICs that do not have local memory. They access the host memory and preserve coherency of a local cache with the host memory through CXL.cache.
Type 2. Type 2 CXL devices support all three protocols. These are computes, such as GPUs and FPGAs, that have local memory accessible to other hosts. They can exchange the data with other hosts via CXL.mem.
Type 3. Type 3 CXL devices implement only CXL.io and CXL.mem interfaces. These devices are used to increase memory capacity and bandwidth.

user:
<essay>Apparatus 
The experimental apparatus used in this study consisted of a personal computer(PC) equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 Ti graphics card, HTC Vive Pro Eye head-mounted display(HMD), two Vive Trackers (one for the participant‚Äôs left foot and one for the right foot), the Unity game engine, and the Ready Player Me software. The Unity game engine was used to create the virtual environment and the interactive scenarios. The Ready Player me software was  used to generate virtual avatars.
The experiment was conducted in a soundproof room. The room was equipped with a personal computer(PC) that was used to collect questionnaire answers. During the experiment, participants stood in front of two Vive base stations in the room, and were instructed to wear the VR headset and trackers, which allowed for head and body movement tracking in the virtual environment.  

Avatar set
For the experiment, a total of 144 avatars were generated, with 72 avatars for male participants and another 72 avatars for female participants. The generated avatars‚Äô sex was matched to the participants‚Äô sex to ensure that participants were presented with avatars that matched their own gender. The avatars were further divided into six different experimental conditions, with each condition consisting of 12 avatars. Specifically, for each condition, 4 avatars had red hair, 4 avatars had black hair, and 4 avatars  had gold hair, with different hairstyles for each avatar. In addition, 6 avatars within each condition had a comparatively darker skin color, while the remaining 6 had a comparatively lighter skin color. 12 avatars in the same condition wore the same clothing, and there were no duplicated avatars among the 144 total. (See appendix for the visual information.) 

Participants
Participants were recruited within the KAIST community. 34 undergraduate and graduate students participated in the experiment (17 females, 17 males, mean age: 00, age SD = 0.00, age range: 00-00 years, 3 foreigners, 31 Koreans), all with normal or corrected-to-normal vision. All participants received 20,000won for their participation (duration: 60-90 min) 

Procedure
Preparation
Once participants arrived, consent agreement documents were provided to obtain their signature. Subsequently, instructions regarding the experiment were given to the participants, and after ensuring their comprehension of the experiment procedure, they were escorted to the experiment room to don the HMD and trackers.

Eye calibration
When the participant was ready to begin the experiment, an eye calibration process was performed. 

Avatar selection
Following the eye calibration, a total of 12 avatars were presented to the participants in a grid format with 4 columns and 3 rows. Participants were then instructed to select an avatar as ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù, while the researcher simultaneously selected an avatar as ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù. Depending on the condition, participants either chose their own ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù or it was chosen by the researcher. The hair color of the ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù matched that of the participant‚Äôs ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù, while their skin color differed from the ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù.

Avatar exposure
After the avatar selection stage, ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù and ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù were sequentially presented in front of the participant for 3 seconds each. During this presentation, the avatar was rotated in a horizontal direction by 360 degrees, thereby enabling the participant to perceive the avatar‚Äôs distinguishing features from the back, side, and front of the avatar evenly. 

Avatar embodiment
Following the avatar exposure, participants proceeded with the avatar embodiment process in which they were presented with a virtual mirror displaying ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù and ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù. Participants were then instructed to answer a series of questions regarding the mirror‚Äôs display of the avatars‚Äô bodies and perform several movements, including clapping, touching their left shoulder with their right hand, and touching their friend avatar‚Äôs shoulder with their right hand. They were then asked to mimic the friend avatar‚Äôs pose and take a photo of themselves using the left-hand controller. The friend avatar posed in four different ways sequentially, with each pose involving lifting either the right arm, left arm, right foot, or left foot. Participants were asked to replicate each pose twice. The motion synchronization of ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù with the participant was dependent on the condition, and could either be controlled by a button or remain still. The entire embodiment process was completed in an average of 3 minutes.
   
Visual search task
Next, the participant completed a visual search task involving the identification of either ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù or ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù within a grid of 12 avatars presented in a 4x3 format. At the start of each trial, a pop-up window displaying the target avatar was presented, which participants were required to click to initiate the search task. Once the target image was clicked, the pop-up window closed, and the 12 avatars were presented. Participants were instructed to locate the target avatar as quickly as possible and click on it using their right hand controller. The participants complete 40 trials for each condition, in total 240 trials. </essay>

Data Collection 
During the visual search task, participants‚Äô eye tracking data was collected as well as the reaction time and accuracy rate. After completing each condition, the participants were asked to answer the embodiment questionnaire with a PC in the experiment room. The standardized embodiment questionnaire utilized in this study was derived from Peck and Gonzalez-Franco‚Äôs (2021) research article titled ‚ÄúAvatar Embodiment: A Standardized Questionnaire‚Äù in Frontiers in Virtual Reality.
chatgpt_after:
Great job on writing your methodology section! I have a few suggestions that could help you improve it even more. 

Firstly, it would be helpful to provide some context about the study before diving into the methodology. This could include a brief overview of the research question or hypothesis, and why it's important to investigate. 

Secondly, it would be useful to provide some description of the design of the study, such as whether it's a between-subjects or within-subjects design. 

Lastly, there are a few areas where you could be more specific. For example, you mentioned that the entire embodiment process was completed in an average of 3 minutes, but it would be helpful to specify the range of times participants took to complete the task. Additionally, you could specify how many trials were included in the visual search task, rather than just stating the total number completed across all conditions. 

Overall, your methodology section provides a clear and concise overview of the apparatus, experimental conditions, participants, and procedures used in your study. Well done!

The generated avatars‚Äô sex was matched to the participants‚Äô sex to ensure that participants were presented with avatars that matched their own gender. The avatars were further divided into six different experimental conditions, with each condition consisting of 12 avatars. Specifically, for each condition, 4 avatars had red hair, 4 avatars had black hair, and 4 avatars  had gold hair, with different hairstyles for each avatar. In addition, 6 avatars within each condition had a comparatively darker skin color, while the remaining 6 had a comparatively lighter skin color. 12 avatars in the same condition wore the same clothing, and there were no duplicated avatars among the 144 total. (See appendix for the visual information.) 

Participants
Participants were recruited within the KAIST community. 34 undergraduate and graduate students participated in the experiment (17 females, 17 males, mean age: 00, age SD = 0.00, age range: 00-00 years, 3 foreigners, 31 Koreans), all with normal or corrected-to-normal vision. All participants received 20,000won for their participation (duration: 60-90 min) 

Procedure
Preparation
Once participants arrived, consent agreement documents were provided to obtain their signature. Subsequently, instructions regarding the experiment were given to the participants, and after ensuring their comprehension of the experiment procedure, they were escorted to the experiment room to don the HMD and trackers.

Eye calibration
When the participant was ready to begin the experiment, an eye calibration process was performed. 

Avatar selection
Following the eye calibration, a total of 12 avatars were presented to the participants in a grid format with 4 columns and 3 rows. Participants were then instructed to select an avatar as ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù, while the researcher simultaneously selected an avatar as ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù. Depending on the condition, participants either chose their own ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù or it was chosen by the researcher. The hair color of the ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù matched that of the participant‚Äôs ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù, while their skin color differed from the ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù.

Avatar exposure
After the avatar selection stage, ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù and ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù were sequentially presented in front of the participant for 3 seconds each. During this presentation, the avatar was rotated in a horizontal direction by 360 degrees, thereby enabling the participant to perceive the avatar‚Äôs distinguishing features from the back, side, and front of the avatar evenly. 

Avatar embodiment
Following the avatar exposure, participants proceeded with the avatar embodiment process in which they were presented with a virtual mirror displaying ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù and ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù. Participants were then instructed to answer a series of questions regarding the mirror‚Äôs display of the avatars‚Äô bodies and perform several movements, including clapping, touching their left shoulder with their right hand, and touching their friend avatar‚Äôs shoulder with their right hand. They were then asked to mimic the friend avatar‚Äôs pose and take a photo of themselves using the left-hand controller. The friend avatar posed in four different ways sequentially, with each pose involving lifting either the right arm, left arm, right foot, or left foot. Participants were asked to replicate each pose twice. The motion synchronization of ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù with the participant was dependent on the condition, and could either be controlled by a button or remain still. The entire embodiment process was completed in an average of 3 minutes.
   
Visual search task
Next, the participant completed a visual search task involving the identification of either ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù or ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù within a grid of 12 avatars presented in a 4x3 format. At the start of each trial, a pop-up window displaying the target avatar was presented, which participants were required to click to initiate the search task. Once the target image was clicked, the pop-up window closed, and the 12 avatars were presented. Participants were instructed to locate the target avatar as quickly as possible and click on it using their right hand controller. The participants complete 40 trials for each condition, in total 240 trials. 

Data Collection 
During the visual search task, participants‚Äô eye tracking data was collected as well as the reaction time and accuracy rate. After completing each condition, the participants were asked to answer the embodiment questionnaire with a PC in the experiment room. The standardized embodiment questionnaire utilized in this study was derived from Peck and Gonzalez-Franco‚Äôs (2021) research article titled ‚ÄúAvatar Embodiment: A Standardized Questionnaire‚Äù in Frontiers in Virtual Reality.
essay:
Methodology 

Visual search task is a widely used experimental paradigm to study visual attention and perception in cognitive psychology[1,2,3]. During the visual search task, visual stimuli are presented with a display to participants and participants are asked to search for a specific target stimulus among distractors. In my experiment, the visual search task was manipulated using a within subject design to study whether the pop-out phenomenon applies for the self-avatar representation in virtual reality.

Apparatus 
The experimental apparatus used in this study consisted of a personal computer(PC) equipped with an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 Ti graphics card, HTC Vive Pro Eye head-mounted display(HMD), two Vive Trackers (one for the participant‚Äôs left foot and one for the right foot), the Unity game engine, and the Ready Player Me software. The Unity game engine was used to create the virtual environment and the interactive scenarios. The Ready Player me software was  used to generate virtual avatars.
The experiment was conducted in a soundproof room. The room was equipped with a personal computer(PC) that was used to collect questionnaire answers. During the experiment, participants stood in front of two Vive base stations in the room, and were instructed to wear the VR headset and trackers, which allowed for head and body movement tracking in the virtual environment.  

Avatar set
For the experiment, a total of 144 avatars were generated, with 72 avatars for male participants and another 72 avatars for female participants. The generated avatars‚Äô sex was matched to the participants‚Äô sex to ensure that participants were presented with avatars that matched their own gender. The avatars were further divided into six different experimental conditions, with each condition consisting of 12 avatars. Specifically, for each condition, 4 avatars had red hair, 4 avatars had black hair, and 4 avatars  had gold hair, with different hairstyles for each avatar. In addition, 6 avatars within each condition had a comparatively darker skin color, while the remaining 6 had a comparatively lighter skin color. 12 avatars in the same condition wore the same clothing, and there were no duplicated avatars among the 144 total. (See appendix for the visual information.) 

Participants
Participants were recruited within the KAIST community. 34 undergraduate and graduate students participated in the experiment (17 females, 17 males, mean age: 00, age SD = 0.00, age range: 00-00 years, 3 foreigners, 31 Koreans), all with normal or corrected-to-normal vision. All participants received 20,000won for their participation (duration: 60-90 min) 

Procedure
Preparation
Once participants arrived, consent agreement documents were provided to obtain their signature. Subsequently, instructions regarding the experiment were given to the participants, and after ensuring their comprehension of the experiment procedure, they were escorted to the experiment room to don the HMD and trackers.
Eye calibration
When the participant was ready to begin the experiment, an eye calibration process was performed. 
Avatar selection
Following the eye calibration, a total of 12 avatars were presented to the participants in a grid format with 4 columns and 3 rows. Participants were then instructed to select an avatar as ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù, while the researcher simultaneously selected an avatar as ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù. Depending on the condition, participants either chose their own ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù or it was chosen by the researcher. The hair color of the ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù matched that of the participant‚Äôs ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù, while their skin color differed from the ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù.
Avatar exposure
After the avatar selection stage, ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù and ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù were sequentially presented in front of the participant for 3 seconds each. During this presentation, the avatar was rotated in a horizontal direction by 360 degrees, thereby enabling the participant to perceive the avatar‚Äôs distinguishing features from the back, side, and front of the avatar evenly. 
Avatar embodiment
Following the avatar exposure, participants proceeded with the avatar embodiment process in which they were presented with a virtual mirror displaying ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù and ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù. Participants were then instructed to answer a series of questions regarding the mirror‚Äôs display of the avatars‚Äô bodies and perform several movements, including clapping, touching their left shoulder with their right hand, and touching their friend avatar‚Äôs shoulder with their right hand. They were then asked to mimic the friend avatar‚Äôs pose and take a photo of themselves using the left-hand controller. The friend avatar posed in four different ways sequentially, with each pose involving lifting either the right arm, left arm, right foot, or left foot. Participants were asked to replicate each pose twice. The motion synchronization of ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù with the participant was dependent on the condition, and could either be controlled by a button or remain still. The entire embodiment process was completed in an average of 3 minutes.
Visual search task
Next, the participant completed a visual search task involving the identification of either ‚ÄúMy avatar‚Äù or ‚ÄúFriend avatar‚Äù within a grid of 12 avatars presented in a 4x3 format. At the start of each trial, a pop-up window displaying the target avatar was presented in the center of the participants‚Äô view so that it could work as a fixation point. To initiate the search task, participants were required to click the pop-up window. Once the target image was clicked, the pop-up window closed, and the 12 avatars were presented. Participants were instructed to find the target avatar as quickly as possible and click on it using their right hand controller. The participants complete 40 trials for each condition, in total 240 trials. 

Data Collection 
One of the most common measures in visual search experiments is reaction time[1]. Therefore, during the visual search task, participants‚Äô reaction time was collected as well as the eye tracking data and accuracy rate. After completing each condition, the participants were asked to answer the embodiment questionnaire with a PC in the experiment room. The standardized embodiment questionnaire utilized in this study was derived from Peck and Gonzalez-Franco‚Äôs (2021) research article titled ‚ÄúAvatar Embodiment: A Standardized Questionnaire‚Äù in Frontiers in Virtual Reality[4].  

[1] Treisman, A. M., & Gelade, G. (1980). A feature integration theory of attention. Cognitive Psychology, 12(1), 97-136. 
[2] Wolfe, J. M. (1994). Guided search 2.0 A revised model of visual search. Psychonomic Bulletin & Review, 1(2), 202-238. 
[3] Duncan, J., & Humphreys, G. W. (1989). Visual search and stimulus similarity. Psychological Review, 96(3), 433-458.
[4] Gonzalez-Franco, M., & Peck, T. C. (2018). Avatar embodiment. towards a standardized questionnaire. Frontiers in Robotics and AI, 5, 74.

user: Then how do I write down the result of RMANOVA?
chatgpt_after:
The reporting of a repeated measures ANOVA (RMANOVA) output depends on tabular format which is determined by the software you used. However, in general, you should report the main effects of the variables and the interaction effects between variables based on the output.

The main effects of the independent variables typically include the F-statistic, degrees of freedom (df), and p-value, as well as some measure of effect size (such as partial eta-squared). You can state the interpretation of these results in the text.

For example, you might write something like <sent>"Results of a RMANOVA revealed a significant main effect of time (F(2.7, 98.74) = 8.51, p < .001, partial eta squared = .19), but no significant main effect of treatment (F(1,37) = 1.63, p = .21, partial eta squared = .04)." </sent>

You should also report the interaction effects between variables (if any). These effects can be interpreted similarly based on the F-statistic, degrees of freedom, and p-value for each interaction term.

It's important to contextualize the statistical results with the research question in order to provide unambiguous interpretation.

prev_essay: While fuel consumption of internal combustion engine is determined according to the velocity planning, fuel consumption of hybrid vehicle is determined by both velocity planning and energy management strategy. Energy management strategy (EMS) of hybrid electric vehicle (HEV) is a critical factor in the control of HEV because loss of fuel consumption optimality can be more than 15% in heavy hilly road conditions due to selection of wrong EMS1). In the energy management problem, full information on future driving conditions is required to obtain the optimal solution, which is impossible. However, using available future information, a near-optimal performance can be achieved. This strategy, using available future information to achieve near-optimal performance is predictive EMS (p-EMS). Optimal velocity planning, just like energy management strategy, can also reduce fuel consumption without any change in the vehicle architecture, just within the change inside software. In this paper, a systematic control scheme that co-optimize velocity planning and p-EMS is proposed. The optimal velocity planning and proposed energy management strategy altogether shows significant effect on fuel consumption reduction without compromise on the travel time and safety.

chatgpt_after:
Sure. Let me give you an example to better understand the concept:

Ambiguous sentence: <sent>I gave the ball to the girl, who was wearing a red t-shirt.</sent>

In this sentence, it is unclear whether the girl or the ball was wearing a red t-shirt. By adding a comma, we can clarify the meaning of the sentence.

Revised sentence: <sent>I gave the ball to the girl, who was wearing a red t-shirt.</sent>

By adding a comma before ‚Äúwho,‚Äù we can clarify that the girl, not the ball, was wearing a red t-shirt.

Does that make sense to you?

prev_essay:
Hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs) have gained popularity as a sustainable transportation option due to their ability to reduce fuel consumption and greenhouse gas emissions compared to conventional vehicles. HEVs utilize multiple power sources, typically an internal combustion engine and an electric motor, to provide propulsion. However, to achieve optimal performance and efficiency, HEVs require advanced control strategies, including optimal velocity planning and energy management.
Optimal velocity planning involves determining the most efficient speed trajectory for a vehicle based on various factors such as road conditions, traffic, and vehicle characteristics. The goal of optimal velocity planning is to minimize energy consumption while maintaining a desired travel time or distance. By optimizing the vehicle's speed profile, optimal velocity planning can reduce energy waste caused by inefficient acceleration or braking.
Energy management is another critical component of HEV control. In an HEV, the energy flow between the power sources, such as the battery and the internal combustion engine, must be optimized to minimize energy loss and improve overall efficiency. Energy management strategies involve controlling the power sources to provide the required propulsion while minimizing energy waste and maximizing energy recovery during regenerative braking.
The combination of optimal velocity planning and energy management can lead to significant improvements in HEV performance and efficiency. Multi-objective optimization techniques can be used to simultaneously optimize both velocity planning and energy management, considering multiple performance metrics, such as energy consumption, travel time, and emissions. Multi-objective optimization can help find trade-offs between conflicting objectives and provide a set of optimal solutions that balance different goals.
In conclusion, optimal velocity planning and energy management are essential components of HEV control, and their optimization through multi-objective optimization techniques can lead to significant improvements in HEV performance and efficiency.

prev_essay:
In this research, the gait assistance effect of a cable-driven robot was verified. Gait stability was evaluated using the 6-minute walking test [1]. The results were analyzed based on experiments involving four male participants. The experimental protocol consisted of four phases: walking for familiarization, walking for measurements (No Robot), walking for measurements (Robot Off), and walking for measurements (Robot On). The 'No Robot' state refers to walking without the robot, while 'Robot Off' and 'Robot On' states refer to walking with the robot. The only difference between the 'Robot Off' and 'Robot On' states is that the 'Off' state indicates the robot without activation, while the 'On' state indicates the robot with activation.
An experiment results with detail is shown in Figure 1. The mean value of torso movements in Robot On state was 3.2 degree. This value was slightly different to the mean value of torso movements in No Robot state and Robot Off state, 3.1 degree and 3.0 degree respectively. However, it was found that the standard deviation of torso movements showed meaningful differences. The standard deviation of torso movements in Robot On state was 1.0 degree, while the standard deviation in No Robot state was 2.0 degree. This distinction between No Robot and Robot On is understood as the improvement of stride regularity of participants. Also, the negligible gap between Robot Off and No Robot state has proved that this improvement was not only originated from the wearing of the Robot.
As a result of the analysis, the diminishing trend of the standard deviation of torso fluctuation during Robot On has shown the possibility of improvement in gait stability. In the future, experiments with a larger number of participants, including females, will be implemented for better generalization.

user: I heard that the word "very" is not used generally in scientific writing. Which word would be best for the alternative of "very" in my paragraph?
chatgpt_after: You are correct that the word "very" is generally not used in scientific writing as it is considered too informal. Instead of using "very complex", you can choose a more appropriate and precise adjective that accurately describes the level of complexity. For example, you can use "extremely complex", "highly intricate", "profoundly complicated", "exceedingly sophisticated", or "markedly convoluted", depending on the degree of complexity you want to convey.
prev_essay: The semiconductor manufacturing industry, which is a representative example of the high-tech manufacturing industry, has very complex process characteristics. One of them is that logistics management within the semiconductor FAB is a very complex but important issue. In semiconductor FAB, numerous processes are required to complete a product, so there are many WIP(Work-In-Progress)s in the process. In addition, depending on the type of product, the processing steps that the product goes through are different, and there are alternative equipment that can perform each step. As a result, WIPs in semiconductor FAB generate logistics flows fluidly according to the current situation of FAB.

First of all, the two triangles should be put together and form a circle in the middle. Inside the newly formed circle, you then put the long green gear inside the formed circle. It should be standing perpendicular with the table surface. Then, we put together two blue cubes in a way that forms a circle in the middle on top of the long green gear in the same way that the triangles were put together in a circle  by the end of the gear. The end step is putting the green flat-surfaced cube on the top of the two blue cubes. The green block should be in the middle of the two blue blocks. The green cube will link the two blue cubes by having one part on each cube.  The other group‚Äôs replica is slightly different because we did not describe the rotation of the two rectangular parts of the tree. user: Today I learned about resuls: by and with. However, I am still confused about the difference between those. Can you explain to me?
chatgpt_after:
Yes, of course. The terms "by" and "with" are used when discussing how an action was performed or what was used to achieve a result. 

"By" is used to indicate the primary agent of an action or the most important contributor to a result. For example, "The study was conducted by the research team" indicates that the research team was the primary agent responsible for conducting the study.

"On the other hand, "with" is used to indicate the means or instrument used to achieve a result. For example, "The data were analyzed with statistical software" indicates that statistical software was the instrument used to analyze the data.

In other words, "by" refers to who did something, while "with" refers to what or how something was done. Does that help clarify the difference between the two terms for you?

user: How about of and in?
chatgpt_after:
Sure, I'd be happy to explain the difference between "of" and "in."

"Of" and "in" can both be used as prepositions in scientific writing to show relationships between different parts of a sentence. 

"Of" typically indicates the relationship between two things, such as ownership or possession. For example, "The data of the study" means the data that belongs to the study or is associated with the study.

"In" typically indicates location or placement within an object, group or space. For example, "The study was conducted in a laboratory" describes the location where the study was conducted.

In summary, "of" describes possession or belonging, while "in" describes location or placement. 

Would you like me to provide any other examples or explanations of scientific writing terminology?

user: is it recommended to use "ought to"?
chatgpt_after: It's generally not recommended to use "ought to" in scientific writing. Instead, it's better to use more objective and formal language, such as "should" or "must" to convey specific instructions or recommendations. These terms are more precise, and less ambiguous, and will help to enhance the clarity and professionalism of your writing. However, there may be certain cases where "ought to" could be used appropriately, such as when expressing a strong likelihood or probability based on evidence. Nonetheless, it's important to be cautious with its use and to remember the importance of being precise and clear in scientific writing.

The traditional 5-day workweek has been the standard for many years. However, recently there has been a growing interest in the idea of a 4-day workweek. Many people advocate that reducing the workweek to four days can lead to increased productivity, employee satisfaction, and a better work-life balance.
To test whether people perceive working four days a week as more productive than working five days a week, a survey was conducted among a sample of 17 participants. It is possible that some individuals may not use the extra day off productively, and may instead spend it watching TV or resting, which may not have a significant benefit.
In conclusion, the results of this study indicate that even though 50% of the people do not believe that a 4-day workweek would be more productive, most people would still prefer it.  While the 4-day workweek may have benefits, individual preferences and the impact on productivity should be carefully considered before implementing this model in the workplace.

essay:
The traditional 5-day workweek has been the standard for many years. However, recently there has been a growing interest in the idea of a 4-day workweek. Many people advocate that reducing the workweek to four days can lead to increased productivity, employee satisfaction, and a better work-life balance.
To test whether people perceive working four days a week as more productive than working five days a week, a survey was conducted among a sample of 17 participants. Fig. 1 shows that most people responded favorably to the idea of working four days a week.  Participants expressed their desire to use the extra day for activities such as exercise, hobbies and leisure, which could improve their physical and mental well-being. However, fig. 2 reveals that half of the responses disagreed that working 4 days a week would be more productive. It is possible that some individuals may not use the extra day off productively, and may instead spend it watching TV or resting, which may not have a significant benefit.
In conclusion, while the survey revealed that half of the respondents did not believe that a 4-day workweek would be more productive, a majority of people still preferred it. However, it is important to carefully consider individual preferences and the potential impact on productivity before implementing this model in the workplace.

essay:
Majority of people may have experienced to wear their school uniform. This traditional thought that students should wear school uniform may last very long time, even for these days. However, recently there are some schools which allow students to wear free clothes when they go to school. Of course freedom of students is important, but I think that high school should control student's clothes and they should wear constant clothes as school uniform. There are two big reasons that I asserts with this statement.
Firstly, wearing school uniform is very economical. It is needless to say that young people are usually interested in fashion or trend. So they buy new clothes or accessories that are famous for their friends. For example, in 2000s, there were some students so-called "backbone broker" in South Korean that required a kind of expensive jackets such as "Goose down" for their parents. If high school control students to wear school uniform, students do not have to buy expensive and high-quality clothes to wear in school. Moreover, It is worth pointing that as they wear school uniform for 5 days a week, they don't need large amount of clothes on daily life. As I pointed out, wearing school uniform can reduce payment on clothes, so it is economical.
Secondly, I would like to say that school uniform is able to represent school's identity. Obviously, once school uniform select for specific school, usually it would not change for very long term. In other words, many people who graduated those school wore the school uniform. The point is that such school uniform could be a symbol of school. For instance, if you walk along that street and see some students wearing school uniform, you could recognize the name of school students are in. Furthermore, wearing school uniform may integret student's mind, because it provide same design for all of students. I think that school uniform is capable of making an image and identity of each school.
In conclusion, wearing school uniform is helpful in reducing economcal burden. Also, it could make a kind of identity in school. Thus, I think that school uniform should be required for high school students.

user: I learned about transitions. How do I use proper transitions in my essay better than now?
chatgpt_after:
Great! Good use of transitions can significantly improve the flow and coherence of your essay. Let's get started with the revision process. 

1. First, go through your essay and identify the areas where you have not used any transitions at all or where there are weak or inappropriate transitions. 

2. Then, consider the relationship between the different ideas and points you have presented in your essay. Identify how the ideas connect and try to use transition words or phrases that best fit the relationship between the ideas.

3. You can use several types of transitions such as addition, comparison, contrast, cause and effect, or chronological transitions. 

4. For example, use the addition transitional phrases "furthermore" or "in addition" to highlight an additional point or "in conclusion" to connect your final thoughts.

5. Comparison transitions such as "similarly" or "likewise" can indicate that two ideas are similar or comparable.

6. Contrast transitions such as "however" or "still" can reveal a difference or contrast between two ideas.

7. Cause and effect transitions such as "therefore" or "thus" can indicate the resulting effect of a particular cause.

8. Chronological transitions such as "firstly," "secondly," and "finally" can indicate the order in which the ideas are presented.

Remember to use transitions appropriately and sparingly. Overusing transitions can make your essay sound monotonous and tedious. 

Once you have identified the areas where you need to revise, start by replacing weak or inappropriate transitions with appropriate and strong transitions, and remove any unnecessary transitions.

Do you have any questions based on these steps?
prev_essay:
Majority of people has experienced wearing their school uniform. The traditional notion that students should wear school uniforms has persisted for a long time, even today. However, some schools allow students to wear regular clothes when they attend school. While student freedom is important, I believe that high schools should control students' clothing and require them to wear a consistent school uniform. There are two main reasons why I assert this statement.
Firstly, wearing school uniforms is very economical. It's a well-known fact that young people are usually interested in fashion or trends, so they buy new clothes or accessories that are popular among their friends. For example, in the 2000s, some students in South Korea were known as "backbone brokers" and required expensive jackets, such as Goose down, from their parents. If high schools controlled what students wore with a uniform, they would not need to buy expensive and high-quality clothes to wear to school. Moreover, since students wear the same school uniform for five days a week, they don't need a large amount of clothes for everyday life. With this in mind, wearing school uniforms can reduce the cost of clothing and is therefore an economical choice.
Secondly, school uniforms are able to represent a school's identity. Once a school selects a uniform, it usually remains unchanged for a long time. In other words, many people who graduated from a school wore the same uniform. Therefore, a school uniform becomes a symbol of the school. For instance, if you see some students wearing a particular school uniform on the street, you can recognize the name of the school they are attending. Wearing a school uniform may also foster a sense of unity and integration among students, as they all wear the same design. I believe that school uniforms can create a unified image and identity for each school.
In conclusion, wearing school uniforms helps to reduce economic burden and creates a sense of identity at school. Therefore, I believe that school uniforms should be required for high school students. By wearing uniforms, students avoid the need to buy expensive clothing and can represent their school's identity. This fosters a sense of unity, which is valuable for academic and social success.

For example, in the 2000s, some students in South Korea were known as "backbone brokers" and required expensive jackets, such as Goose down, from their parents. If high schools controlled what students wore with a uniform, they would not need to buy expensive and high-quality clothes to wear to school. Moreover, since students wear the same school uniform for five days a week, they don't need a large amount of clothes for everyday life. With this in mind, wearing school uniforms can reduce the cost of clothing and is therefore an economical choice.
Secondly, school uniforms are able to represent a school's identity. Once a school selects a uniform, it usually remains unchanged for a long time. In other words, many people who graduated from a school wore the same uniform. Therefore, a school uniform becomes a symbol of the school. For instance, if you see some students wearing a particular school uniform on the street, you can recognize the name of the school they are attending. Furthermore, wearing a school uniform may also foster a sense of unity and integration among students, as they all wear the same design. Unity of a school may make students passionate and of course it would help learning or communicating with other students in same school. I believe that school uniforms can create a unified image and identity for each school.
In conclusion, wearing school uniforms helps to reduce economic burden and creates a sense of identity at school. Therefore, I believe that school uniforms should be required for high school students. By wearing uniforms, students avoid the need to buy expensive clothing and can represent their school's identity. This fosters a sense of unity, which is valuable for academic and social success.

For instance, many universities and companies prefer a person who can perform well but the people who are in need can't satisfy others need due to their insufficient learning and chances. First, let's focus on organizational parallelism. It's important to transition smoothly between paragraphs and present your ideas in a logical and chronological manner. Here's an example of a revised introduction that uses organizational parallelism:

"In modern society, it is crucial to ensure fair opportunities and well-being for all citizens. To achieve this, governments should concentrate on supporting those in need, such as individuals from low-income households and the elderly. By providing education, resources, and aid, governments can contribute to a more equitable society that values the potential of all its members."

In this revised introduction, we've used parallel structure to emphasize the importance of supporting those in need and to highlight the actions that the government can take to make a positive impact.

Next, let's look at syntactic parallelism. You've explained the concept well in your summary, and I think your essay could benefit from using this technique more consistently. Here's an example of how you can revise a sentence to use parallel structure:

Original: "For instance, many universities and companies prefer a person who can perform well but the people who are in need can't satisfy others need due to their insufficient learning and chances."

Revised: "For instance, many universities and companies prefer individuals who can perform well, but those in need often lack the opportunities and resources to develop their skills."

By using parallel structure in this sentence, we've simplified the language and made the sentence more concise and easy to follow.

Finally, let's focus on the conclusion. It's important to summarize the main points of the essay and restate the thesis in a memorable way. Here's an example of a revised conclusion that uses parallelism:

"In conclusion, governments play a crucial role in ensuring a fair and equitable society by supporting those in need. By providing education, aid, and resources to individuals from low-income households and the elderly, governments can help pave the way for a more equitable future. By investing in the potential of all members of society, we can create a world where opportunity is accessible to all."

I hope these revisions help you improve your essay and apply the concepts of organizational and syntactic parallelism!

More specifically, as people get old, their abilities to work reduce, so they have to retire and are not financially independent anymore. Also, they are vulnerable to diseases and medical conditions that require constant attention and medical intervention. Government should not left them in these poor conditions, because they have been contribute to society and still have a wealth of knowledge, skills, and experience that can be helpful for society. Therefore, government should provide seniors with medical and economical supports that contribute to the well-being of both society and individuals who are aging.
Last thing government should care about is stabilty of the society. If the government doesn't focus on helping people in need, the differnce between people's socioeconomic status will worsen. Consequently, the society might become more unstable. Historically, it is clear that there are more conflicts between people when the inequality of chances and unbalanced wealth are evident. For example,  society may experience high rates of crime and violence, as individuals compete for resources and power. Also, societies may suffer from a breakdown in social connections and trust, leading to societal disintegration and a loss of collective values. Hence, government have to care more about people in need for social benefits and stabilty.
 Nowadays, most governments around the world seems to function well, but there are major problems related to the inequality of social status and wealth. These are problems what democracy systems have to solve. One way to adress these problems is strengthening policies that support the social underprivileged. The government should help people in need more carefully to ensure their chance to learn and become sucessful. Moreover, for the citizen's future, government should aid seniors with economical and medical supports that acknowledge the valuable contributions they have made to society. In conclusion, to achieve the critical role of government maintaining society's peace and balanced state, they should concentrate on supporting minorities who have been historically dismissed and overlooked. </essay>

chatgpt_after:
Great! Let's start by reviewing your essay and identifying areas where you can incorporate modal verbs to improve your writing. 

First, let's look at your thesis statement. Does it clearly state your main argument or point of view? If not, let's revise it to make it more concise and specific. 

Next, let's review your body paragraphs. Are you using strong evidence to support your claims? Are you using modal verbs to express your intentions and convey your message effectively? 

As you revise your essay, keep in mind the different situations where you can use modal verbs. For example, "may" can be used to express possibility or permission, while "must" can be used to express obligation or necessity. "Can" can be used to express ability or possibility, while "should" can be used to express advice or recommendation. "Might" can be used to express possibility or uncertainty, while "ought to" can be used to express obligation or duty. 

Remember to also consider the tone and style of your writing. Using modal verbs can help you convey your message more effectively and make your writing more persuasive.

<essay>Some universities, such as kaist, made the first year of college student as major-free. Still the most college don't use that method but I think universities should require that the first year of college be major-free for three reasons.
First, most student choose college's name, not a major. In Korea, the most hot standard for college is whether the location of college is Seoul or not. The fame also can be a standard and whether what major they have is not a consideration. So when the the student enter the college, they may regret about their choice of the major. But, when the first year of college is major-free, they can adapt to college system and then can choose the major more carefully.
Second, the quality of student can be better. Students in college is still young and most of them don't have strong image of their future and vision. If they experience other major's class, which is very attractive for them, they would change their originally thinking major. So we shouldn't prevent a student from accessing variable subject and the major-free system can be good way for it. As they select the most fit major, the quality of all major group will be improve.
Lastly, the community from college to student get activate and it works as positive-feedback. In major-free system, student choose the major. So the people in each major advertise passionally and research hard to make students' attention. After the students choose the major, they also work hard for next students and for themself to get much budget from the universities.
Therefore, for the universities' future, the major-free system for the first-year is needed. Some says it is irresponsible for students. BUt to acheive a goal in this hard word, students should develop their own's ability.</essay>

However, when we use electronic devices, we could use pdf for book and write down lecture note on electronic note. Therefore even though we use a lot of books and lecture notes, the weight to our bag has only our electronic devices weight.
Next, most of class use internet nowadays. As internet's effect became larger and larger to our life, the use of internet became larger. We could take quiz on internet, or watch lecture on internet etc. Therefore, it makes student must use electronic devices while studying. Now few of class use zoom to make untact lecture and use google form to take quiz. Because of it, using electronic devices became necessary in class.
In conclusion, there are two advantages that students use electronic devices in class. First, It makes student's bag much lighter than before. Second, electronic devices could help to follow class using internet.

prev_essay:
School Uniforms are common recommended by many high schools in almost every region of Korea for students to wear. When entering middle school, teenagers in Korea have to wear school uniforms. Some students are uncomfortable with this rule and resist following their school and teacher. To require wearing school uniforms is good for several reasons. 

Firstly, school uniforms are a sign of students and teenagers' status and standing in society. If someone is wearing a school uniform and gets into trouble, many people will offer help. Research and statistics show that people are more likely to help someone who is wearing a school uniform in dangerous or emergency situations. Therefore, school uniforms protect many students.

Another reason that school uniforms are useful is for students during off-campus activities, such as shopping or using public transportation. Students who wear school uniforms are often given special discounts or gifts at events. Additionally, they can take part in cultural events, such as movies, concerts, and book readings, without the need for additional identification.

Lastely, School uniforms bring uniformity among students and create a sense of harmony. It prevents anyone from feeling discriminated or different.

School uniforms are useful and helpful. We need to consider one more aspect: whether removing school uniform rules would foster greater connections throughout our communities.

prev_essay:
School Uniforms are common recommended by many high schools in almost every region of Korea for students to wear. When entering middle school, teenagers in Korea have to wear school uniforms. Some students are uncomfortable with this rule and resist following their school and teacher. To require wearing school uniforms is good for several reasons. 

Firstly, school uniforms are a sign of students and teenagers' status and standing in society. If someone is wearing a school uniform and gets into trouble, many people will offer help. Research and statistics show that people are more likely to help someone who is wearing a school uniform in dangerous or emergency situations. Therefore, school uniforms protect many students.

Another reason that school uniforms are useful is for students during off-campus activities, such as shopping or using public transportation. Students who wear school uniforms are often given special discounts or gifts at events. Additionally, they can take part in cultural events, such as movies, concerts, and book readings, without the need for additional identification.

Lastely, School uniforms bring uniformity among students and create a sense of harmony. It prevents anyone from feeling discriminated or different.

School uniforms are useful and helpful. We need to consider one more aspect: whether removing school uniform rules would foster greater connections throughout our communities.

prev_essay:
Title: Shoud we wear a school uniform?

School Uniforms are common recommended by many high schools in almost every region of Korea for students to wear. When entering middle school, teenagers in Korea have to wear school uniforms. Some students are uncomfortable with this rule and resist their school and teacher. To require wearing school uniforms is good for several reasons. 

Firstly, school uniforms are a sign of students and teenagers' status and standing in society. If someone is wearing a school uniform and gets into trouble, many people will offer help. Research and statistics show that people are more likely to help someone who is wearing a school uniform in dangerous or emergency situations. Therefore, school uniforms protect many students.

Another reason that school uniforms are useful is for students during off-campus activities, such as shopping or using public transportation. Students who wear school uniforms are often given special discounts or gifts at events. Additionally, they can take part in cultural events, such as movies, concerts, and book readings, without the need for additional identification.

Lastely, School uniforms bring uniformity among students and create a sense of harmony. It prevents anyone from feeling discriminated or different.

School uniforms are useful and helpful in many ways. We need to consider one more aspect: whether removing school uniform rules would foster greater connections throughout our communities.

essay:
Have you ever resisted because you did not want to wear school uniforms? Or have you worn school uniforms inappropriately to look cool? Korean students have to wear school uniforms when they enter middle school. Are school uniforms necessary? Most school students are avoiding to wear it and resisting to follow the rule that they should wear school uniforms, however I think school uniforms are needed in school for several reasons.

 First of all, School uniforms are an identification that proves the students or teenagers and allows them to get help and advantages. By wearing a uniform, students can easily get help and ask questions to adults during emergency situations. Moreover, they also can take advantage when they are using public transportation, shopping, and watching a movie at the theater. We can easily find the various educational and cultural organizations that give discounts or free tickets for students. Students don‚Äôt need a supplementary document and qualification if they wear school uniforms.

 Secondly, school uniforms help to reduce economic polarization. If school uniforms rules are removed, teenagers will tend to spend more money and time to find unique clothes and  trendy outers. There are some statistics that show teenagers are very sensitive to fashion and always want to wear fancy clothes except only school uniforms. School uniforms make students feel uniformity since there are no differences.

 Lastly, School Uniforms allow the students to navigate the right path. While wearing a uniform, students feel more duty and responsibility, so they tend to take the right path. Some research suggests that 80% of students decided to be more careful not to act inappropriately due to this responsibility while wearing school uniforms.

 In conclusion, school uniforms are needed for students to get help and advantages, not to waste money and time, and to navigate to the right path. Therefore, we must consider the positive effects of school uniforms for students and society. Furthermore, we have to think about new ways for students to feel more comfortable and to express their freedom and personality freely while remaining in school uniforms.

chatgpt_after:
Sure, let's take a look at your paragraph.

Second, the paragraph seems to lack a clear focus or thesis statement. It jumps from discussing the proper use of the budget to the importance of military and education, and then ends with a vague statement about the difficulty of maintaining a country without countermeasures. 

To revise this paragraph, I suggest starting with a clear thesis statement that outlines the main point you want to make. Then, focus on developing your ideas in a logical and organized manner. Here's an example of a revised paragraph: 

Proper and reasonable use of the budget is crucial for a functioning economy. While it's important to assist those in need, such as the poor, there are other areas that require attention as well. In Korea, for example, military and education are crucial for competing with other countries. Investing in research and development is also important to keep up with advanced countries. However, it's important to note that assisting the poor is also crucial for maintaining social stability and reducing inequality. essay:
At least, in Korea, we have been wearing school uniforms at middle school and high school from 1950s. But lots of people saying that "school uniform have to be vanished". Also, I am the one who think that school uniform is not must-needed item at school.
  There are some reasons why school uniforms are made. The first reason is to make students feel they're belong to the very group. About 90 years ago, Japan invaded Korea and tried to control Korean students not to use Korean language, not to learn Korean history, and so on. Japanese people tried to make all the people wear same clothes to feel they're a part of the Japanese students, finally they started to wear school uniforms. The second reason is to control students easily. As a result of the research, when all the people in group are wearing same clothes, each person pretends to behave as the group members behave. By the same way, when all the students in school are wearing same clothes, they pretend to behave together or similarly. In this situation, teachers are easy to control them, so that it is efficient to the group which the number of students are a lot.

user:
<essay>As technology continues to develop, various types of individual devices have been invented. One of the results is that everyone in class tends to use some form of technology. However, some argue that using tablets and laptops can be distracting. Despite the potential side effects, the use of tablets/laptops has many advantages, which are highlighted below.

The first benefit is that digital devices allow students to use the necessary digital abilities required for their classes. Many professors provide ‚Äúlecture notes‚Äù to students, which they need to access during class time. Taking notes on laptops and tablets improves students‚Äô learning and memorization abilities. Additionally, subjects such as programming, design, and composition often require the use of digital devices during class. Therefore, using tablets and laptops increases students' productivity and engagement during class.

Secondly, digital devices can help reduce the burden on students during campus life. Devices like tablets can replace bulky textbooks, various types of notes, pens/pencils, and memo sheets. All necessary equipment for studying is contained in a single portable device. Furthermore, students can perform various functions on a tablet, such as recording lectures and submitting assignments online, making studying more convenient and efficient.

The third benefit is that professors and TAs can execute more efficient work styles by incorporating electronic devices into their classes. By using such devices, teachers can receive assignments online, automatically check grades and attendance, and present lectures more effectively. Many professors are already adopting digital systems in their classes. Thus, using tablets and laptops in class can make not just students but also professors and TAs comfortable and efficient.

Although there are numerous advantages, some users may use tablets and laptops inappropriately. However, such issues can be tackled by encouraging healthy habits and self-discipline among students, rather than implementing policies that prohibit the use of digital devices. Therefore, tablets and laptops should be allowed in class, given the advantages mentioned above.</essay>

user: Today I learned about the comma rules. When there is a list that contains two or more elements, we should use commas to separate them
chatgpt_after:
Great job! Here is how we can start revising your essay based on what you learned today.

First, I recommend reading through your essay and identifying any lists with two or more elements.
Once you have identified these lists, make sure to add a comma after each element, separating them clearly.

For example:

Before revision: My favorite fruits are apples bananas and oranges.

After revision: My favorite fruits are apples, bananas, and oranges.

Next, it is important to double-check that you are using commas correctly in any complex sentences. Here are some common comma rules we discussed in class to help guide you:

1. Use a comma to separate independent clauses when they are joined by a coordinating conjunction (and, but, or, nor, for, so, yet) - for example: I like to read books, but I prefer to watch movies.

2. Use a comma after introductory words or phrases - for example: Before we begin our lesson, let's review last week's material.

3. Use commas to set off non-essential clauses or phrases - for example: My friend Emily, who is traveling to Europe next week, loves to try new foods.

Remember, good writing takes practice, so don't be afraid to revise your essay multiple times until it is clear, concise, and error-free.

Some people in Korean have a question about military service. Why only men should go to military? Why only man spand their precious time in military? Is tihs true that military system is discriminatory about gender? I don't think so. Of course, it is hard to go military, but it can't be reason that military service should be extended to encompass female Korean. Let me give you some reasons that encourage my opinion.
 First, the problem of man's military service is not gender discrimination. It is just the problem of differences from men and women. In fact, men usually are stronger and have greater health. It is physical difference from men and women. The military, as you known as have a lot of time that exercise, training, etc. Some military's hard training is difficult to women to sucess that. Because of women's physical, the military service is hard to be extended to women. Of course, there are some strong women that can work more that men. But this is not good in terms of efficiency.

 Lastly, because of women military service, the tax on military will increase. These days, already we have to pay lots of tax in military. We have to rebuild some dormitary and pay money to military women. These all the tax. Do you have enough money to pay it?
 To sum up, extending military service to women is not good for us because lots of money like tax and false asspect that military serviece of men is discrimination of gender. user: syntatic parallelism
chatgpt_after:
Great question! Syntactic parallelism is a writing technique that involves using grammatically parallel structures in a sentence or paragraph. Essentially, it means using the same grammatical structure to connect related ideas or items. This helps to make the writing clearer, more organized, and more memorable to the reader.

Here's an example of syntactic parallelism:

Non-parallel: <sent>The child was laughing, jumping up and was singing his favorite song.</sent>

Parallel: <sent>The child was laughing, jumping up, and singing his favorite song.</sent>

In the non-parallel sentence, the verb forms used for laughing, jumping, and singing are different, creating an uneven structure. In the parallel sentence, each verb is expressed in the same gerund form, creating a more balanced and pleasing structure.

To use syntactic parallelism in your writing, you can start by identifying related ideas or items that you want to connect in a sentence or paragraph. Then, try to use the same grammatical structure for each item. This might include using the same verb tense, the same prepositional phrase, or the same noun.

Remember, using syntactic parallelism can help to improve the clarity and effectiveness of your writing, but it should be used sparingly and appropriately. Overuse of parallel structures can make your writing sound repetitive or boring.

To write a good thesis statement, you need to identify the main point or argument of your essay. A thesis statement is a sentence that summarizes the main idea of your essay and presents your stance on the topic. The thesis statement is the hook, the main idea and the conclusion all rolled into one. 

In order to write a clear and strong thesis statement, you need to:

1. Identify the main idea or argument of your essay.
2. Make sure that your thesis statement is clear, concise and specific.
3. Avoid vague or general statements.
4. Your thesis statement should be in the first paragraph of the essay.

Try to follow this pattern, and I'll help you revise if there's any issue.

responses

2. Education and training programs - Governments also offer education and training programs to help individuals gain the skills and knowledge needed to secure better-paying jobs and improve their economic prospects. These programs might include vocational training, adult education classes, and job placement services.

user: I wonder how can I use articles 'a', 'an', and 'the' properly.
chatgpt_after:
Great! Understanding how to use articles correctly is an important aspect of writing in English. Let's start by reviewing the basic rules for using articles:

1. Use "a" or "an" before a singular countable noun that is not specific or known to the listener/reader. Use "a" before words that begin with a consonant sound, and "an" before words that begin with a vowel sound.

Example: I saw a bird in the tree. (The bird is not specific or known to the listener/reader.)

2. Use "the" before a singular or plural noun that is specific or known to the listener/reader.

Example: The bird in the tree was singing. (The bird is specific and known to the listener/reader.)

3. Do not use an article before uncountable nouns or plural nouns that are not specific or known to the listener/reader.

Example: I need water. (Water is an uncountable noun.)

Now, let's take a look at your essay and see where you can improve your use of articles. Please provide your essay, and we can begin the revision process.

user: I want to know comma rules.
chatgpt_after:
Great! Commas are an important punctuation mark in English writing. Let's start by reviewing some basic comma rules:

1. Use a comma to separate items in a list of three or more.

Example: I need to buy apples, bananas, and oranges.

2. Use a comma to separate two independent clauses joined by a coordinating conjunction (and, but, or, nor, for, yet, so).

Example: I want to go to the beach, but it's raining.

3. Use a comma after an introductory phrase or clause.

Example: After finishing my homework, I went to bed.

4. Use a comma to set off nonessential information (words, phrases, or clauses) in a sentence.

Example: My friend, who lives in New York, is coming to visit me.

Now, let's take a look at your essay and see where you can improve your use of commas. Please provide your essay, and we can begin the revision process.

chatgpt_after:
Yes, there are a few grammar errors in your essay. Let's go over some of them and how to revise them:

1. "In these days" - It's better to use "these days" or "nowadays" instead.

2. "There are a lot of things that attracts people" - This should be written as "There are many things that attract people" since "things" is plural.

"if that two majors are completely different, students have to study much more new subjects so their graduation will be delayed" - This should be revised to "if the two majors are completely different, students will have to take many more additional courses and potentially delay their graduation."

In this system, students will make less mistake to select their major and it will be decreased that students change their major.
 For these reasons, I believe universities shoud make their first year student be major-free.

user:
<essay> Should the government help those most in need , or should it help all of its citizens regardless of their socioeconomic background?. 
 There have been a lot of controversies on the social security system and governmental welfare. Some says the government should help and support all of its citizens regardless of their socioeconomic background insisting the fairness. But I think the government should help those most in need to achieve the goal of real fairness for several reasons. 
 First of all , helping those in need is the way to accomplish the practical fairness. If the government supplies financial supports to all the citizen including rich people , is it a right way to achieve the true meaning of fairness? Such help would be meaningless and even increase the gap between rich and poor people which can cause a severe social problem. To make more citizens happier, the government productive should help people in need.
 In addition to the problem of practical fairness , helping all people is not efficient. It is well known that the happiness increases when the income rises up to certain extent, but after some level , happiness has little to do with the income level . Since the budget of the government for welfare is confined , we should use it efficiently. The amount of support that each individual receives becomes far less if the government helps all the people. However, by giving support to people, it would be more effective to increase the overall happiness of the country and make the country more productive.
 In conclusion, the government should prioritize helping those in need to achieve practical fairness, increase overall happiness, and promote productivity in society.</essay>
chatgpt_after:
Great job summarizing your essay! To begin revising, let's focus on strengthening your introduction. Instead of saying <sent>"There have been a lot of controversies on the social security system and governmental welfare,"</sent> try starting with a more attention-grabbing statement or anecdote related to the topic. This will engage the reader right from the start.

Next, let's take a look at your thesis statement. While you do state your stance on the issue, <sent>"I think the government should help those most in need,"</sent> it is not clear and concise enough. Try rephrasing it to: <sent>"The government should prioritize assisting individuals with the greatest need to ensure practical fairness, increased overall happiness, and a more productive society,"</sent> to make your stance clearer and more compelling.

Moving on to your body paragraphs, it is helpful to use topic sentences that clearly introduce the main idea of each paragraph. For example, in the first paragraph, you could write, <sent>"Providing financial support to all citizens, regardless of their socioeconomic background, is not an effective means of achieving true fairness and can exacerbate wealth disparities. Therefore, the government should prioritize assistance for those with the greatest need." </sent>This makes the topic of the paragraph clear and helps the reader follow your argument.

Additionally, instead of just stating your opinion, try to provide evidence and examples that support your ideas. This will make your argument more convincing. For example, you could cite studies or statistics that show how providing support to those in need boosts overall happiness and productivity. 

Finally, be sure to conclude your essay with a strong overall statement that summarizes your argument and leaves the reader with something to think about. Reiterate your stance and the reasons why you believe it's the best approach.

I hope these suggestions help with your essay revision. Don't hesitate to ask me if you have any questions or need further guidance!

essay:
In the KAIST, freshmen can take any class without limits. It is able because they are major-free at the first year of KAIST. But I think this is not helpful to students. This major-free system makes students to lose focusing of their likes, and students will be stressed by studying other subjects, and they can't use time efficiently.
 Firstly, major-free year of first disturbs students from studying their favorite subjects. Most of students go to the college to study about deep knowledge or useful skill and creativity. They can learn these things before changing their focusing and mind. If the college change the first year to be major-free, then the students should take classes of all major subjects. They should study hard to earn a good grade. This can give disturbing to students who don't like other subjects or are not good at other subjects than their favorite subjects. 
 Also, because of studying subjects that students actually don't have curiocity, they can feel stressful. Students are already exhausted by learning their major. More neccessary classes for graduation of college only gives more painful labor to students. They already study other subjects at the high school, though it was little, so they don't want to study more about them. 
 Lastly, the time is limited, but using one year for studying minor subjects is not efficient to students and universities. If all of universities have a lot of support and money from government and people, first year of being major-free can be good choice. But, this system makes students to graduate later and spends money to use more professors and more classrooms. I this is not efficient at all. 
 So, I think major-free system at first year is not efficient. I think instead of using this system, universities should more lighten their limits and graduation level.

chatgpt_after:
Great! Let's go ahead and revise your essay, keeping in mind the use of cause and effect transition signals. First, I suggest you review your essay to identify any cause and effect relationships. Then, use these transition signals to make the relationships clear to the reader. Here are some steps to follow:

1. Start by reading through your essay and highlighting any instances of cause and effect.
2. Use a sentence connector to show cause and effect relationships between sentences. Some examples of cause connectors include "since," "because," and "as a result." Examples of effect connectors include "therefore," "consequently," and "thus."
3. Use coordinating conjunctions to connect two clauses that have a cause and effect relationship. Some popular coordinating conjunctions include "and," "or," and "but."
4. Use a subordinating conjunction to begin a dependent clause that identifies the cause or effect. Examples of subordinating conjunctions include "if," "when," and "although."

Can you revise your essay following these steps? Don't hesitate to ask me any questions along the way.

Good job on your essay! However, there are several areas where you can make improvements to clarify your points and make the content flow logically. Here are some steps you can take to revise your essay:
